cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles WSW of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to move W-NW into the eastern Gulf, turn N and cross the Florida Big-Bend area, then accelerate NE and move out over the western Atlantic well south of New York toward Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend near Cedar Key

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, Georgiaâ€“South Carolina coast, and the open Atlantic south of the Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; peak gusts generally below 25 kt as the system passes well south and east of the port.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for New York harbor because the cyclone remains far offshore.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light showers possible Saturday into Sunday with totals generally under 1 inch.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip-current risk along the New Jersey and Long-Island Atlantic beaches during the weekend.
